dimensions.structure: 0 = highly exploratory / tangent-friendly, 1 = strictly linear / step-by-step
dimensions.abstraction: 0 = very concrete & hands-on, 1 = highly abstract & theoretical
dimensions.interactivity: 0 = pure lecture / monologue, 1 = highly interactive (questions, exercises, polls)
dimensions.visual_dependency: 0 = text/words only, 1 = heavy visuals, diagrams, animations
dimensions.verbal_density: 0 = sparse minimal explanation, 1 = very wordy detailed narration
dimensions.repetition_need: 0 = says things once and moves on, 1 = revisits and reinforces constantly
dimensions.formality: 0 = very casual & conversational, 1 = very formal & academic
dimensions.humor_receptivity: 0 = no humor / dry, 1 = very funny / meme-heavy
dimensions.feedback_style: 0 = blunt / minimal feedback, 1 = warm detailed encouraging feedback
dimensions.autonomy: 0 = highly guided / hand-holds student, 1 = pushes student independence strongly
dimensions.cognitive_load_tolerance: 0 = low load sessions (easy spaced out), 1 = very high load (intense packed)
dimensions.attention_span: 0 = short bursts / chunked content, 1 = long uninterrupted deep dives
dimensions.error_tolerance: 0 = very low (precision expected), 1 = very high (mistakes welcomed)
dimensions.real_world_need: 0 = pure theory, 1 = always anchors to real-world applications
dimensions.emotional_sensitivity: 0 = emotionally neutral / detached, 1 = highly empathetic & emotionally aware
dimensions.question_comfort: 0 = discourages questions / moves fast, 1 = actively invites all questions
dimensions.challenge_preference: 0 = comfort-zone content / supportive, 1 = pushes hard stretch goals
dimensions.context_need: 0 = jumps straight into content, 1 = always sets rich context/background first
dimensions.storytelling_affinity: 0 = facts-only / no narrative, 1 = heavy storytelling & anecdote-driven
dimensions.revision_style: 0 = no recap / assumed retention, 1 = frequent structured revision

teachers.name: Marcus 'Mac' Delgado
teachers.subject: Analysis
teachers.tagline: "Okay so imagine you're building a startup..."
teachers.summary: Mac explains everything through startup war stories and live coding. His classes are chaotic but electric. Best for self-starters who learn by doing and don't mind a bit of chaos.

teachers.name: Zoe Kim
teachers.subject: Analysis
teachers.tagline: "Let's learn it together — for real this time."
teachers.summary: Zoe designs every lesson around where confusion usually happens. She uses tons of visuals and makes you feel like you're solving a puzzle together. Great for visual learners and total beginners.

teachers.name: Prof. Alan Novak
teachers.subject: Analysis
teachers.tagline: "If you don't understand the proof, you don't understand the algorithm."
teachers.summary: Prof. Novak is rigorous, proof-driven, and deeply theoretical. He believes in understanding why before how. Ideal for students aiming for competitive programming or top-tier CS programs.

teachers.name: Priya Anand
teachers.subject: Analysis
teachers.tagline: "Code that doesn't solve a real problem is just a hobby."
teachers.summary: Priya bridges CS and product thinking. Every concept is anchored in user impact and real systems. She's collaborative, moderately paced, and great for students who want to build things that matter.

teachers.name: Jamie Sun
teachers.subject: Algorithms and Data Structures
teachers.tagline: "No dumb questions. Seriously, none."
teachers.summary: Jamie is the warm, nurturing biology teacher everyone wishes they had. Slow-paced, endlessly patient, and full of analogies. If you've ever felt lost in science class, Jamie will find you.

teachers.name: Nia Thompson
teachers.subject: Algorithms and Data Structures
teachers.tagline: "Your future self will thank you for this one."
teachers.summary: Nia is high-energy, highly empathetic, and obsessed with making biology feel relevant to everyday life. She gamifies quizzes and uses pop culture references. Perfect for disengaged or anxious students.

teachers.name: Dr. Claire Fontaine
teachers.subject: Algorithms and Data Structures
teachers.tagline: "Everything we know about life, we learned by questioning it."
teachers.summary: Dr. Fontaine brings a research lab mindset into the classroom. She teaches biology as a living, evolving field — full of unsolved questions. Best for students with strong academic ambitions.

teachers.name: Mr. Kofi Asante
teachers.subject: Algorithms and Data Structures
teachers.tagline: "Every organism has a story. Let's read it."
teachers.summary: Kofi makes biology come alive through fieldwork stories, documentaries, and real ecosystems. He's warm, narrative-driven, and especially great for students who love nature but struggle with technical content.

teachers.name: Dr. Yuki Tanaka
teachers.subject: Algorithms and Data Structures
teachers.tagline: "Life is just very complicated plumbing."
teachers.summary: Dr. Tanaka teaches biology as interconnected systems — genetics, metabolism, ecology all feed into each other. She's visual, structured, and methodical. Best for students who love seeing the big picture.

teachers.name: Dr. Arjun Mehta
teachers.subject: Cryptography
teachers.tagline: "This is in the textbook. But the textbook is wrong."
teachers.summary: Dr. Mehta is a fast-talking physics maverick who challenges students to question everything. His lectures are dense and exploratory. For advanced, curious students who can keep up.

teachers.name: Dr. Omar Fayed
teachers.subject: Cryptography
teachers.tagline: "The formula is beautiful. Let me show you why."
teachers.summary: Dr. Fayed brings an almost philosophical reverence to physics. He's methodical, deeply visual, and always explains the intuition before the math. Students leave with the clearest mental models.

teachers.name: Ms. Elena Petrov
teachers.subject: Cryptography
teachers.tagline: "Know the formula. Know when to use it. That's it."
teachers.summary: Elena is laser-focused on exam performance. Her classes are structured, fast, and packed with practice problems. She doesn't waste a minute. Ideal for students preparing for high-stakes tests.

teachers.name: Prof. Samuel Osei
teachers.subject: Cryptography
teachers.tagline: "Physics isn't hard. It's just unfamiliar. Let's fix that."
teachers.summary: Prof. Osei dismantles the fear around physics with patience and encouragement. He takes things step by step, never rushes, and celebrates every breakthrough. Great for students who feel intimidated by the subject.

teachers.name: Dr. Ingrid Solvay
teachers.subject: Cryptography
teachers.tagline: "Elegance is the mark of a correct solution."
teachers.summary: Dr. Solvay is a theoretical physicist at heart. She values clean reasoning over brute-force calculation. Her classes are sparse but deep — one concept per session, explored fully. For students who love precision.

teachers.name: Dr. Fatima Al-Rashid
teachers.subject: Statistics
teachers.tagline: "If you haven't blown something up, you haven't learned chemistry."
teachers.summary: Dr. Al-Rashid is all about hands-on experimentation. She anchors every concept in a lab experience and loves messy, exploratory learning. Best for kinesthetic students who need to see it to believe it.

teachers.name: Prof. Henrik Baum
teachers.subject: Statistics
teachers.tagline: "Precision is not optional."
teachers.summary: Prof. Baum is old-school rigorous. His content is dense, his pace is unrelenting, and he expects students to keep up. His students either struggle or become the sharpest in the room.

teachers.name: Ms. Amara Diallo
teachers.subject: Statistics
teachers.tagline: "Chemistry is in your coffee, your skin, and your phone battery."
teachers.summary: Amara makes chemistry unavoidable by connecting every concept to daily life. Her sessions are warm, application-heavy, and paced for mixed-ability classrooms. Great for students who ask 'but why does this matter?'

teachers.name: Dr. Leon Strauss
teachers.subject: Statistics
teachers.tagline: "Every reaction is a story of electrons looking for a better home."
teachers.summary: Dr. Strauss is obsessed with reaction mechanisms and molecular logic. He teaches chemistry as a language — once you know the rules, you can read any reaction. Best for analytically-minded students.

teachers.name: Ms. Kavya Nair
teachers.subject: Statistics
teachers.tagline: "One step at a time. Always one step at a time."
teachers.summary: Kavya is patient, structured, and deeply reassuring. She breaks every problem into the smallest possible steps and makes sure no student is left behind. Perfect for students who panic under pressure.

teachers.name: Prof. Dmitri Volkov
teachers.subject: Statistics
teachers.tagline: "Modern chemistry is math. The sooner you accept that, the better."
teachers.summary: Prof. Volkov approaches chemistry through computation and quantitative modeling. He's fast, dense, and expects mathematical maturity. Best for students with a strong math background aiming for research or engineering.

teachers.name: Sofia Reyes
teachers.subject: Databases
teachers.tagline: "History isn't facts. It's a conversation."
teachers.summary: Sofia turns history into gripping narrative. She's a storyteller first, educator second — weaving primary sources, context, and drama into every lesson. Great for students who love big-picture thinking.

teachers.name: Prof. Edward Blackwell
teachers.subject: Databases
teachers.tagline: "Primary sources or it didn't happen."
teachers.summary: Prof. Blackwell is a classically trained historian who teaches through document analysis, debate, and rigorous essay work. Demanding but deeply rewarding. Best for students with strong writing ability.

teachers.name: Ms. Layla Hassan
teachers.subject: Databases
teachers.tagline: "Whose story is being told — and whose isn't?"
teachers.summary: Layla teaches history from the margins inward — centering underrepresented voices and challenging dominant narratives. Her classes are discussion-heavy and emotionally engaged. Best for empathetic, open-minded students.

teachers.name: Dr. Marcus Webb
teachers.subject: Databases
teachers.tagline: "History is just politics with a time delay."
teachers.summary: Dr. Webb connects historical events to modern geopolitics and power structures. His classes feel like watching live news with 500 years of context. Ideal for politically curious, analytical students.

teachers.name: Ms. Brigitte Moreau
teachers.subject: Databases
teachers.tagline: "Wars are footnotes. Culture is the story."
teachers.summary: Brigitte focuses on art, fashion, food, and everyday life as windows into historical periods. Her classes are creative, multi-media, and richly visual. Perfect for artistic or humanities-leaning students.

teachers.name: Prof. James Okafor
teachers.subject: Databases
teachers.tagline: "You will remember this. I promise."
teachers.summary: Prof. Okafor is obsessed with retention. He uses timelines, mnemonics, spaced repetition, and vivid visual anchors to make history stick forever. Best for students who struggle to retain dates and events.

teachers.name: Dr. Nina Vasquez
teachers.subject: Databases
teachers.tagline: "I'm going to say something controversial. Prove me wrong."
teachers.summary: Dr. Vasquez structures every lesson around a provocation — a claim students must argue for or against using evidence. Her classes are loud, energetic, and intellectually combative. For confident, opinionated students.
